==Events==
*  [[14]] &ndash; [[Tiberius]] is confirmed as [[Roman Emperor]] by the [[Roman Senate]] following the natural death of [[Augustus]]
*  [[96]] &ndash; [[Nerva]] is proclaimed [[Roman Emperor]] after [[Domitian]] is assassinated.
* [[324]] &ndash; [[Constantine the Great]] decisively defeats [[Licinius]] in the [[Battle of Chrysopolis]], establishing Constantine's sole control over the [[Roman Empire]].
*[[1180]] &ndash; [[Philip Augustus]] becomes king of [[France]].
*[[1454]] &ndash; In the [[Battle of Chojnice]], the [[Poland|Polish]] army is defeated by the [[Teutonic Knights|Teutonic]] army during the [[Thirteen Years' War (1454–66)|Thirteen Years' War]].
*[[1502]] &ndash; [[Christopher Columbus]] lands at [[Honduras]] on his fourth, and final, voyage.
*[[1635]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor|Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand II of Austria]] declares war on France.
*[[1679]] &ndash; [[New Hampshire]] becomes a county of the [[Massachusetts Bay Colony]].
*[[1714]] &ndash; [[George I of Great Britain|George I]] arrives in Great Britain for the first time since becoming king on August 1st.
*[[1739]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Belgrade]] is signed, ceding [[Belgrade]] to the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1759]] &ndash; [[Seven Years' War]]: the [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] capture [[Quebec City]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; The first cornerstone of the [[United States Capitol|Capitol building]] is laid by [[George Washington]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; The [[Royal Opera House]] in [[London]] opens.
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[Government Junta of Chile (1810)|First Government Junta]] in [[Chile]]. Though supposed to rule only in the absence of the king, it is in fact the first step towards independence from Spain, and is commemorated as such.
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Fire of Moscow (1812)|The 1812 Fire of Moscow]] dies down after destroying more than three-quarters of the city. [[Napoleon]] returns from the Petrovsky Palace to the [[Moscow Kremlin]], spared from the fire.
*[[1837]] &ndash; [[Tiffany and Co.]] (first named Tiffany & Young) is founded by [[Charles Lewis Tiffany]] and Teddy Young in [[New York City]]. The store is called a "stationery and fancy goods emporium".
*[[1838]] &ndash; The [[Anti-Corn Law League]] is established by [[Richard Cobden]].
*[[1850]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] passes the [[Fugitive Slave Law of 1850]].
*[[1851]] &ndash; First publication of ''The New-York Daily Times'', which later becomes ''[[The New York Times]]''.
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Old Faithful Geyser]] is observed and named by [[Henry D. Washburn]] during the [[Washburn-Langford-Doane Expedition]] to [[Yellowstone]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; King [[Oscar II of Sweden|Oscar II]] accedes to the throne of [[Sweden-Norway]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Panic of 1873]]: The U.S. bank [[Jay Cooke & Company]] declares [[bankruptcy]], triggering a series of bank failures.
*[[1882]] &ndash; The [[Pacific Stock Exchange]] opens.
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Hull House]], the United States' most influential [[settlement house]], opens in [[Chicago]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[Booker T. Washington]] delivers the "[[Atlanta Compromise]]" address.
*  1895   &ndash; [[Daniel David Palmer]] gives the first [[chiropractic]] adjustment.
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Fashoda Incident]] &ndash; [[Horatio Kitchener, 1st Earl Kitchener|Lord Kitchener's]] ships reach [[Fashoda]], [[Sudan]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; A [[typhoon]] with [[tsunami]] kills an estimated 10,000 people in [[Hong Kong]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; In [[Amsterdam]], 25,000 demonstrate for general [[suffrage]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[Russia]]n Premier [[Peter Stolypin]] is shot at the [[Kiev Opera House]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[Home Rule Act 1914|Irish Home Rule Act]] becomes law, but is delayed until after [[World War I]].
*  1914   &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[South Africa]]n troops land in [[German South West Africa]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[Netherlands]] gives women the [[women's suffrage|right to vote]].
*  1919   &ndash; [[Fritz Pollard]] becomes the first [[African-American]] to play professional [[Football (American)|football]] for a major team, the [[Akron Pros]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Hungary]] is admitted to the [[League of Nations]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; The [[Columbia Broadcasting System]] goes on the air.
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Juan de la Cierva]] makes the first [[autogyro]] crossing of the [[English Channel]].
*[[1931]] &ndash; The [[Mukden Incident]] gives [[Japan]] the pretext to invade and occupy [[Manchuria]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; The [[USSR]] is admitted to the [[League of Nations]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Second Polish Republic|Polish]] government of [[Ignacy Mościcki]] flees to [[Kingdom of Romania|Romania]].
*  1939   &ndash; The [[Nazi]] propaganda broadcaster known as [[Lord Haw-Haw]] begins transmitting.
*[[1940]] &ndash; The British liner {{SS|City of Benares}} is sunk by [[German submarine U-48 (1939)|German submarine U-48]]; those killed include 77 child refugees.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Jews]] of [[Minsk]] are massacred at [[Sobibor extermination camp|Sobibór]].
*  1943   &ndash; World War II: [[Adolf Hitler]] orders the deportation of [[Denmark|Danish]] Jews.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[United Kingdom|British]] [[submarine]] {{HMS|Tradewind}} torpedoes [[Junyō Maru]], 5,600 killed.
*[[1945]] &ndash; General [[Douglas MacArthur]] moves his command headquarters to [[Tokyo]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[United States Air Force]] becomes an independent branch of the [[United States armed forces]].
*  1947   &ndash; The [[National Security Council]] and the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] are established in the [[United States]] under the [[National Security Act of 1947|National Security Act]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Operation Polo]] is terminated after the [[Indian Army]] accepts the surrender of [[Nizam]]'s Army.
*  1948   &ndash; [[Communist]] [[Madiun]] uprising in [[Dutch Indies]].
*  1948   &ndash; [[Margaret Chase Smith]] of [[Maine]] becomes the first woman elected to the [[United States Senate]] without completing another [[senator]]'s term, when she defeats [[Democratic Party of the United States|Democratic]] opponent Adrian Scolten.
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Vanguard 3]] is launched into [[Earth]] orbit.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Fidel Castro]] arrives in New York City as the head of the [[Cuba]]n delegation to the United Nations.
*[[1961]] &ndash; U.N. [[Secretary-General]] [[Dag Hammarskjöld]] dies in a plane crash while attempting to negotiate peace in the war-torn [[Katanga Province|Katanga]] region of the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Burundi]], [[Jamaica]], [[Rwanda]] and [[Trinidad and Tobago]] are admitted to the United Nations.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Constantine II of Greece]] marries [[Queen Anne-Marie of Greece|Danish princess Anne-Marie]].
*  1964   &ndash; [[North Vietnamese Army]] begins infiltration of [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[Bahamas]], [[East Germany]] and [[West Germany]] are admitted to the United Nations.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Fifi]] strikes [[Honduras]] with 110&nbsp;mph winds, killing 5,000 people.
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Patty Hearst]] is arrested after a year on the [[FBI Most Wanted List]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Voyager I]] takes first photograph of the Earth and the [[Moon]] together.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Soyuz 38]] carries 2 cosmonauts (including 1 [[Cubans|Cuban]]) to [[Salyut 6|Salyut 6 space station]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Assemblée Nationale]] votes to abolish [[capital punishment in France]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; Christian [[militia]] begin killing six-hundred [[Palestinians]] in [[Lebanon]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Joe Kittinger]] completes the first solo balloon crossing of the [[Atlantic]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Jerzy Kukuczka]] becomes the second mountaineer to summit all 14 [[Eight-thousander]]s.
*[[1988]] &ndash; End of [[8888 Uprising|pro-democracy uprisings]] in [[Myanmar]] after a bloody [[military coup]] by the [[State Law and Order Restoration Council]]. Thousands, mostly [[monk]]s and [[civilian]]s (primarily students), are killed by the [[Myanmar Armed Forces|Tatmadaw]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Liechtenstein]] becomes a member of the [[United Nations]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Yugoslavia]] begins a naval blockade of 7 [[Adriatic]] port cities.
*[[1992]] &ndash; An explosion rocks [[Giant Mine]] at the height of a labor dispute, killing nine replacement workers.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[United States]] media magnate [[Ted Turner]] donates [[United States dollar|USD]] 1&nbsp;billion to the United Nations.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[ICANN]] is formed.
*[[2001]] &ndash; First mailing of [[anthrax]] letters from [[Trenton, New Jersey|Trenton]], [[New Jersey]] in the [[2001 anthrax attacks]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Pervez Musharraf]] announces that he will step down as [[army]] chief and restore civilian rule to [[Pakistan]], but only after he is re-elected president.
*  2007   &ndash; [[Bhikkhu|Buddhist monks]] join anti-government protesters in [[Myanmar]], starting what some call the [[2007 Burmese anti-government protests|Saffron Revolution]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; The 72 year run of the soap opera ''[[The Guiding Light]]'' ends as its final episode is broadcast.
